page.title: 19CHURCH HOUGHAM
page.content: Church Hougham is very small,having no more than twenty houses,half of which are very old.Some date back to at least the 16th century. The day we went to Church Hougham a man was going to each house in turn and explaining that should the Channel Tunnel be built it will go about 500 feet below their homes! Doctor's Lane is the only road in the village but it branches off,one part leads to St.Laurence's Church and the other to the old school,which is now a private house.Near the church is the well house and we were able to see down a hole just how deep the well is. Church Hougham stands on an ancient highway,first used by the Beaker People who walked from Plum Pudding Hill in Dover through Hougham and Capel to Holy Well in Folkestone.
